intro: Racosperma forrestianum, commonly known as the Forster's acacia, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandplain and lateritic soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for local wildlife.
